comment: Prof. Poole is really passionate about history and gives lectures in a way to create a mental image. He can be forgetful at times but is really nice. when it comes to tests it all comes from his lecture notes with the maps from the text. I would take him again.

It is a history class, not exciting at all. The tests are pretty easy if you go to class and take notes. Which I strongly advise you to do, since Poole does not post anything, but the syllabus on D2L. Flash cards. I got a B on the first 2 tests, then started to actually study, got a 100 on 3rd test, and A on final. FLASH CARDS. Historymemorize

He is a nice person but as a professor to me he doesn't do much. He will not upload power points to D2L and he doesnt respond to emails. You will have 4 test and 1 essay which he grades like he is some english teacher.

It's a lecture class, you have 3 tests and one paper. His lectures have nothing to do with his tests, but He does mention somethings that are important. If you skip class, you could make a solid 70 on the tests. If you don't read the chapters, you'll fail his class. Work hard, and you can make a solid B. Prayers needed for this class, haha

You must read and take good notes to do well, attendance isn't mandatory but I recommend going to class regularly, 4 tests and 1 short essay and he drops your lowest grade, if you want extra credit than speak up in class and ask questions, he wasn't my favorite history prof I've ever had but not too bad

I like him as a person, but as a professor... not at all. I have never disliked a History class this much before. expect 5+ pages of notes a day.  4 Exams and 1 essay. He is picky about the essay and the exams (which he says are supposed to include only the main ideas of what is occurring) include ridiculous questions that do not pertain at all.

He's a great professor! Very informative and he loves what he is teaching! Attendance isn't mandatory, but it will definitely effect your grade if you don't go to class. He's very sweet but a little forgetful at times! 4 tests and 1 essay, and he drops your lowest grade!

Mr. Poole is a good teacher. His class is strictly lecture with notes. If you read the material and go to class, you will do fine. He is a history teacher. He tells stories. He is an older man and he forgets things and will get onto you about not reading, especially the syllabus. But if you go to  class and pay attention, you will do fine.
Read the text and you will be fine. Attendance is not mandatory. Notes are not important, whatsoever. Easy A

Prof. Poole truly loves what he teaches about. Yes, he's old. And yes, he digresses regularly. But he is one of the better professors at kennesaw. If you go to class, take notes, and read the book you'll be fine. SUPPLEMENT them with each other. 4 exams, 1 one page paper. Exams will be a little tricky (pay attention to overall STORY).

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. Grades extremely hard on assignments. Classes are lecture based with powerpoint notes. These are essentially useless because the exams will not contain that information. If your are unfortunate enough to have this Mr Poole, READ YOUR BOOK because the exams are based  on the TEXT. A study group will help you.
Graded really tough on exams. He was not very helpful with grades, but he did know what he was talking about. I enjoy history, but not his class. Would not recommend him.

His class is super boring. He always says that he wont test you on details but his test contains specific dates and names which he doesnt concentrate on in class. There is one paper and he grades it nicely but the tests are hard. He isnt bad but I wouldnt recommend him.
show up and pretend to pay attention and you'll do alright

Very nice guy, and he knows a lot about history, the only problem is the grading for the class. You only have 4 grades: 4 exams and 1 one page single spaced essay and he drops the lowest grade. Powerpoints everyday, only problem is the test has nothing to do with them. I highly suggest reading the book, only way to make a good grade on the exam.

Horrible teacher and incredibly boring. I usually love history and was took college courses in history while I was in high school and I struggled in his class. Tests are over random things that he does not even mention in class. Good luck if you are taking him. After two and half years in college he is one of the worse teachers I have had.

Professor is knowledgable, but not very interesting. If you read the book, come to class, and take notes, the tests are very straight forward. Its boring, however, therefore if you're not interested in history or don't pay attention it might be difficult. Four exams and one essay.

Professor Poole is extremely knowledgeable about history but he is tough. I have made all A's for all 3 semesters I have been at KSU and I barely made a B in this class. He is a very sweet man but his tests are extremely hard and too specific. I studied a week in advance for each test and still made C's. The one paper he assigns is a lifesaver.

Professor Poole wasn't too terribly bad, but I finished the class with a C when I usually make A's. The essay was graded differently for everyone, a lot of favoritism. He also can't hear very well & is a tad bit rude. Just sayin. Attendance isn't necessary, but you should take notes for sure. Good luck!

His class was seriously excruciatingly boring. Rarely takes attendance :) Hes an older man and doesn't project his voice well at all. His tests are irrelevant, never about the important things in history, just mainly the little things people wouldn't think to study. There's one essay for the semester that is fairly easy, though. I wouldn't take him

I really liked this class. He is a good professor. He always makes sure people understand things clearly. I didn't like the fact that he teaches for like the ENTIRE hour and fifteen min. but it's not really a hard class if you actually pay attention and take your notes. He reviews before every exam and the exams are short and multiple choice. EASY.

DO NOT TAKE THIS MAN!!!! he shows favoritism and just wants to argue with you. i am not a kid straight out of high school . It is a lecture class and you have to take notes but he expects everyone to be like him and as educated as he is. DO NOT TAKE HIM

This man thinks that the average non traditional student can memorize so many dates in a 8 week class.  He is so strange and his essays are horrible.  Oh yeah and they are in class essay at the end of his lecturing for 3 and a half hours!  Do not take him if at all possible!

This teacher is really not that hard, you just have to pay attention in class and actually listen to what he has to say. Most people sit on facebook and think they're going to get an A. You don't really need the textbook at all. As long as you listen, you'll do fine. He takes four tests and an essay and drops the lowest. I recommend taking him

Very nice man, good story teller, lousy professor.  he should volunteer to tell stories at libraries, or guest lecture.  He will lecture about an hour+, and only 15% of it will be on the test.  you have to memorize everything. needs refresher training.

Clearly the negative comments are from young students. It's a lecture class, you have to attend class, listen, and know how to take notes. If you can do that and study your notes the tests are a breeze. He will help you in any way he can and he loves the subject. Only negative part of the course was the annoying kids in my class.

This was the worst class I'd ever taken just b/c this old prof gave an exam that was an essay.  You get to choose from 4 diff topics, but he's so biased on what you write. The other exams are ok, but he is unclear on what will be on the exam. You have to memorize everything (dates, places, leaders,etc.)It's a lot of memorization and him being picky
Excellent, knowledgeable professor. If you want to watch movies and have playtime, this isn't the class for you. If you really want to learn from a professional and a great guy, take Mr. Poole!

Yes he is old and a little forgetful at times, but so are some of my younger teachers.  The man knows history and LOVES it, he makes that quite obvious and his love for the topic makes it easier to learn.  He is reachable and very helpful.  If you come to class you will do good.  I think he is worth taking!

Prof. Poole is a very kind man.  However, this is the first time in my life I had to really struggle in a course.  I never missed a lecture, bought a tape recorder, studied his outline and still ended up with a D for the class. 1st and only D I ever had I dont even make C's in my class. I have never ever ever ever been so disappointed in my life.

This professor is useless. He is old and forgetful, as well as very scatter-brained when lecturing. He isn't easy to understand, and makes it almost impossible to reach him. Attendance isn't mandatory, but if you are not there for lectures you won't pass the test. His exams are confusing and he is never clear on what he test over. Try to stay away.

Old, forgetful, waste of time class. He has no method to teaching at all. Grades papers and tests incorrectly. Doesn't use the computer at all. He is mainly deaf. His notes do not help. Tests are comprised of trivia questions, not of anything that can be learned. The only thing that helps are the random facts from the chapters. Stay away.

This professor is TERRIBLE!! I thought this class would be an easy A if I just went to the classes and took notes. NOT THE CASE! The class is so boring that even if you do go to class and take notes, its hard to pay attention b/c he is such a boring professor. His notes are just a giant outline that he reads off of. The only plus is that the tests

Rambles on and on during class. Is never on time to class. He says he wants you to "get the broad idea" yet he asks pretty specific questions on the test that you didn't get on your notes. Class was a waste of time and I definitely wouldn't recommend him to anyone if you have other options.

Mr Poole is a complete joy!  He is kind and totally loves history.  Yes, he is older, forgets things and is late at times.  But he will do anything to help you and he truly wants you to learn history.  The negative comments come from younger students who don't really care about history anyway.  They are only in his class to fulfill a requirement.

Tape record lectures and take good notes. There is NO need to read the textbook. He is VERY sweet and will give you extra points for participating in class discussions. These posters are younger so, I think they are being a little hard on him for being forgetful. He does a great job! My advice:read notes, do not delve into the book.

He was nice to learn from. He wants you to get the main ideas. Mostly the tests were coming from the lectures - but read the book too. Attendence is not required. If you speak up in class, he will add points to your final grade at the end of the course. He was not that hard.

Bad. Bad. Bad.  He rambles on and on about topics that are not on the test.  VERY forgetfull.  Sometimes late. Is not clear AT ALL about what will be on the test. Not approachable for problems.  Will embarass you in front of the class. I do not reccomend this teacher at all!!

Poole is older and not up to date with technology, however he tests on the broad ideas. If you ever have a question he will answer you until it is clear to you. He is forgetful, and sometimes late, however he is so sweet and will stay after class and do whatever he can to help his students out.

He really knows and loves the subject, but his classes are all disorganized lectures. Does not use technology and on test days he would show up without the test and have to go get it from the printing room. He was even more than 40 minutes for the final. He's not the best teacher, but if you read the book and take notes you'll get a good grade.

Very nice guy who is very interested in the subject he teaches. However, he goes off topic very easily and takes forever to get through a chapter. His lectures are very inconsistant and he jumps around with his notes a lot. He will, however, take the time to answer any questions and makes sure the student understands.
Worst professor I've ever had. Can't hear anything. Tests are too difficult. Does not use Vista. Does not check e-mail. Notes are vague but you need to know details for tests.

Hard class for me.  I attended all classes and did poorly on the tests.  No way to improve your grade if you fail tests. He can't hear well and doesn't explain this, just tells you like a robot what all this history stuff is about.  I wouldn't recommend him, unless your a history buff!

Jerry Poole loves the subject he teaches. Very knowledgable and gives good lectures. He's pleasant and is happy to answer students' questions. Tests are from lectures and text readings.Fair grading- drops lowest score. Doesn't take attendance. He's a great professor.
This professor did ramble but he was very fair with grading and loved the topic he taught. He drops the lowest grade and does not test over anything he doesn't cover in class. I like him.

He rambles the whole class period and when you ask him to repeat something he can't hear you. He tells you that he is going to give you a broad aspect of it all but on the test there is more details. Also when you write your essay you have to be specific. I would recommend not taking this professor.

I can't believe some of the comments. He is such a sweet old man. BUt they are right, he can't hear anything! ANd his test questions are worded tricky. You have to go to class because the tests are over the class notes.

Professor Poole knows History but that is it. He does not lecture from the book but his lectures have very little to do with the tests. He does not give study guides and is very unclear as to what material he will cover on the tests. He is rude and does not like you to ask questions or for guidance. DON'T take this professor.

Everyone else's reviews are pretty accurate. This guy can't hear a damn thing and he rambles the entire time. A lot of the material that he lectured on and that was on his outline wasn't on the test. It had to force myself to come to this class. I would definitely reccommend a different instructor.

Easy, but awful. Very unclear in what he expects for tests. Doesn't grade essays anywhere near as tough as he claims. He really just talked down to us all semester, often times taking up a whole class to "remind" us how to take notes and read. Often times got information wrong.

Horrible clas. Rambles in his lectures and writes random words on the board that might or might not be important. The final is over 15 chapters and all the modern states in the world. Way too hard for a general ed class. Boring and no way to understand what he's going to test over. Stay far far away.

Great guy, great class. Very easy to understand. I do not know why he has received some bad ratings (they probably were lazy and blame it on him). He tries to make you think for yourself, which is hard with all the years of public school and indoctrination the liberal arts college tries to instill in students. wish he taught another class!

Horrible, horrile professor. 3 tests, 4 map quizzes. Map quizzes are fine, but the tests cover roughly 20 chapters. He says that "attendence is mandatory". He teaches straight from the textbook, but he will also throw in meaningless crap in class that you will have to know on the test. He tests on small details from the book. Save $ don't take him.

He is the worst professor I've ever had! He is borning, old and useless. Three tests are givin and 4 map quizzes. The quizzes are easy but the tests cover around 15 chapters. The class is a waste of time and money!

world civ..... all he did was talk straight from the book. no point in going to class unless you cant read. very nice man though. 3 tests 4 map quizzes. map quizzes are super easy and can bring your grade up. tests were pretty ok. 2 m/c and 1 essay. essay very specific. mult. choice straight from clas/book

He is very old and boring. He just continues to talk and talk and talk and none of what he says is on the tests. You only get three tests and four map quizzes to pass but the map quizzes are only 10 percent of your grade.  His asked us to know 13 chapters for the final!!! do not take him unless you want to make a C or lower

He is old and cannot hear or see, you must sit within 3 rows of him or he will not hear you. He is very difficult being that you have three tests and 4 map quizzes that determine your four months of hell. His tests are very hard and he asks for DATES! Do not take him I warn you!

This class is so boring. He gives only 3 tests and doesn't curve. He rambles on about nothing and then tests over 18 chapters at a time! This guy is insane and I would not recommend this professor. There are 4 esy map quizzes, but the other 3 tests count as  26% of your grade a piece, yeah its bad!

He is a very sweet man!!! Tests are a little tricky, though. Study all the questions at the end of the chapters and practice with the online quizzes, and you should do great!!! Does offer extra credit if you participate in every discussion, so it wouldn't hurt to look up random facts about what you would be discussing that day!!!

A wonderful teacher - has his favorite topics which were part of his Graduate work - outstanding lecture on the Reformation.  Lots of chapters covered for all tests which is a lot of reading.  Very nice/approachable I enjoyed the class even though I didn't think I would.

Good teacher. very knowledgable of history. test are not very easy, map quizes are very easy. test are over many chapters but that is not his fault. no tidious silly work. just read the chapters and you will be okay.

Good Lectures though long winded.  If you are looking for a teacher who will not show up on occasion, he's the wrong man.  He was there every morning at 8AM (even when he was sick)!  Can't hear well, so make sure you speak up,and he likes thoughtful participation.  But I found the class very informative.  Really liked him, had to work hard for my A
Nice guy, a little deaf though. Rambles during lectures, but doesn't give homework. Tests are difficult. Map quizzes are a breeze. Strict on attendance.

Does not give any outside work. Only 3 tests, 2 multiple choice, 1 essay. Each test is over A LOT of chapters. He tries to include too much material into each test. Tests are somewhat difficult. His attendance policy is also rough.
